Reviews.Content: The only "hold out" in our house that wasn't a relatively new flat screen TV was in our office.  The built-in corner bookcase dictated the size.  This ViewSonic 24" replaced a 15-year old TV.The picture quality is good, especially with digital/ HD channels.  We didn't want a converter box in this location, but the tuner(s) found plenty of unscrambled digital and analog channels from our cable system.As with most LCD TVs, the off-angle viewing is poor, but since this is a smaller room, that isn't a concern.In a previous life I'd sold plenty of ViewSonic computer monitors, so I was aware of their better-than-average quality and reliability.  So far, we're not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Christine A. Anatra
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller tv for the bedroom without paying a lot of money.  Just something inexpensive without sacrificing quality.  I read alot of reviews and the negatives on the reviews are so wrong.  The sound quality is very good for the size, I actually have to lower the volume alot and the picture quality is awesome.  I just have it plugged into my regular cable line and not HDMI so some of the lower channels when changing get a little hung up or don't change fast which really isn't a big deal.  It's only because of the connection.  Also, as far as the light on the tv staying on even when it's off I never notice, my alarm clock is brighter than that.  Great price and great product.  Happy with my purchase and I did alot of research before buying.

Reviews.Title: Pleased but not ecstatic
Reviews.Author: wagnet
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my bedroom. I have it connected to cable and only use it for the most basic tv viewing functions. Picture and sound are very good. However....each time the tv is powered on you have to look at (what becomes annoying after a while) the Viewsonic Logo.  I can only assume this is being displayed while the tv is going through some sort of boot-up. Another annoyance is how sink'n long it takes this tv to change channels.  When I'm channel surf'n I want to buzz up and down through the channels to see what's on tv...click, click, click.  Nope, not on this tv. Expect to wait several seconds while it...does whatever it's doing...to get to the next channel. The problem might be in my cable connection, you say. Nope. I tested that. Connected my old tv back up. No problem. Tried the same thing on the other 4 tvs in my house. Nope. No problem.  Only on this Viewsonic.  Go figure.........

Reviews.Title: My new TV
Reviews.Author: Barnado
Reviews.Content: I did not have any trouble ordering my new TV on line at Amazon.com. My TV arived safely and was easy to take out of the box.  It as very easy to set up for use.  It is also very easy to operate.  I like my new TV.

Reviews.Title: great tv and best price
Reviews.Author: Ann M. Klopp
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my kitchen about a month ago.  The price was the best I found for a similar TV and it has been great.  I only tried the computer monitor option once so I gave it a slightly lower rating because I haven't much info on that.  But the sound is great, picture great, appearance is snappy.  I do have the TV in an eating area nook fairly close to where we sit so the sound may be different in a larger area.  But I think the TV is a very sound purchase.

Reviews.Title: 24" ViewSonic
Reviews.Author: Chi_fan
Reviews.Content: Best value for the price. We needed a small tv for our workout space without investing too much. The tv was easy to set up and has a good picture. Order arived several days before the estimated shipping date using free super saver.

Reviews.Title: Mom's TV
Reviews.Author: ANNETTE ANDERSON
Reviews.Content: My mother loved her birthday gift. The picture was awesome and sound was excellent. I am going to purchase one for myself. Thanks for helping me to make my mother's 73rd birthday great.

Reviews.Title: Good but not Great
Reviews.Author: Average Customer
Reviews.Content: Worked right out of the box.  The screen does not have any visible dead pixels or obvious imperfections.  The picture quality is passable although not above average. When it is used as a computer monitor, the picture quality, and the colors, deteriorate.  There is no standby mode, or it does not work.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality for the Price
Reviews.Author: darkthorn
Reviews.Content: Remote is not good in the dark and the onscreen guide is very small and hard to read when in bed but the overall quality is very good and this makes a perfect bedroom TV.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic 24" TV
Reviews.Author: S. G. Gossett
Reviews.Content: ViewSonic 24" flat screen hidef TV  I bought this tv about a month ago, having never heard of this brand.  I used other buyers reviews as a guide and decided to take a chance on it.  I'm glad I did!  Love this tv.  The picture is just beautiful and the sound is great.  It also has a fairly wide range of viewing from around the room.  This is my first go round with flat screen hi def, But I know a great picture when I see one and proper sound when I hear it.... :-)  I also like the fact that you can change the angle to get the best picture at different heights  (it swivels up or down on its base)  I'm very satisfied and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Does what I need it to do
Reviews.Author: R. Zellner "RZ"
Reviews.Content: I bought this primarily as a monitor for work and I attached a $10 RCA antenna that gets me 60+ very good quality free t.v. channels.  You know for when the boss isn't around. All around the quality is good for the price and the auto-adjustment to my computer settings makes it simple to configure.The only minor negatives I found were that as a monitor, it would be nice if it tilted forward a bit as well as back and my VGA-to-HDMI connection wasn't recognized.  The VGA-to-VGA connection works great though.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey David Pilditch
Reviews.Content: Great television and computer monitor.  Easy to use, program and set up.  Great buy for under 300 bucks, considering 1080p 24" tvs are generally way over $300.

Reviews.Title: GREAT SMALL TV!!
Reviews.Author: Marco Cesar Campos
Reviews.Content: THIS TV IS JUST WHAT I HAVE BEEN SEARCHING FOR, I WANTED A HDTV WHERE I COUD PLAY MY PS3 WITH GREAT SOUND AND GREAT VISION. THIS TV MAKES THE WORK.

Reviews.Title: A great TV with a few quirks
Reviews.Author: KrystleNJ
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few small size LCD HDTVs that I could find that was full HD (1080P). I've had it for about 2 months now and haven't seen any of the problems that some of the other reviewers have reported.I purchased it for use in our kitchen and like it very much. The non-glare screen works very well there. I found that using the "Sports" sound setting gives a much better and louder audio output, than the default "standard" setting, from the built-in speakers.The picture is very sharp when I use it with Blu-ray discs, and the many different Zoom/Aspect Ratio settings help to eliminate any black bands while viewing them.I also enjoy receiving some of the cable channels in widescreen HD with the set's Clear-QAM tuner.However, I have noticed a number of quirks with this model:* The turn-on time until you get a TV display is about 12 seconds, which can seem like forever when you're in a hurry to watch something.* The remote control response can be flakey and sometimes lags. When I go to enter a new channel, I'll often hit a channel digit again, and then to go to channel "XYY" instead of just "XY."* There is no memory for the Zoom/Aspect Ratio setting used for particular channels, so I have to keep changing between the 4:3 and Wide modes when switching channels.* When using the Recall button the set will sometimes stop going back to the previous channel.* The display originally appeared to have a faint green tint to it, but I adjusted the Tint setting slightly to the red ("-3") and I don't notice it any more.Other than these few items, the set works well (so far) and looks great.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture for little $$$$
Reviews.Author: Donald Binkley
Reviews.Content: Needed a smaller picture for bedroom viewing, and was surprised at the high image quality.  Might just use for my photoshop monitor.  The image and sound contrals are so hidden at the bottom of the set's frame that they are hard to locate.  Only one HDMI input.

Reviews.Title: BUY THIS TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Marcus Hall "Duuuuuuude"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because I have a PS3 and I needed a cheap 1080p HD-TV, and boy am I glad I bought the Viewsonic. The games look great and the blu-ray dvds look amazing. I don't use it as a computer monitor so I don't know how well that works. Overall it was easy to setup, the volume is great (the tv's in my room, which is maybe 12' x 12'), picture quality is great, and even the remote is simple and nice. This is a great purchase for a great price. You can't go wrong here. Buy this tv now!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a bedroom
Reviews.Author: K.J.K.
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality, easy to set up. Only had it a short while, but I'm impressed how nice it is for how little it cost. The only gripe I have is that it only has one HDMI connection.

Reviews.Title: Kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: valNmike "ValNMike"
Reviews.Content: We've been watching this (actually 23.5 inch diagonal) Viewsonic HDMI TV in our kitchen for several months now.  I haven't yet gotten another HD Verizon decoder for this TV, but even in standard definition this is a great TV. This is stupid on my part, because I spent a lot of time looking for a 1080p HDTV in this size.  I have only tried out the 1080i HD in another room (where we have the 1080i Verizon DVR) shortly after it arrived (before I installed it in the kitchen).  I use it with some external (computer) speakers with a subwoofer so I cannot accurately comment about its sound quality.  I have it on a wall mount above the refrigerator.  The one thing about this mounting position is I have to be careful when putting things on top of the refrigerator (below the TV).  This is because the control buttons are on the bottom of the unit... a good thing for reaching them when it's up high, but easy to bump and accidentally change something.  Fortunately, the remote control is easy to use to correct (reset) the settings.  The TV menu structure seems intuitive and easy to use.  It has several different inputs (see the product tech details) in addition to an HDMI input for the HD signal.  All in all, I'd buy another one of these if or when I am in the market for another TV this size, such as for a bedroom or as a computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: Gift for mother-in-law
Reviews.Author: J. Lynch
Reviews.Content: This was a xmas gift for my 80 year old mother-in-law. It replaces her analog TV and digital converter box.  She has it hooked up to an indoor antenna and it works fine.  She's happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Flint Junod "value shopper"
Reviews.Content: This was a great value.  The price was lower than the unknown name models, and the performance is great.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Kile S. Vaught
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised. The color and clarity exceeded expectations. Bedroom television and sleek and compact. I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Great for College Gift
Reviews.Author: Abby Normal "Abby"
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my son for a birthday present after his tv died. He was too busy to open it up but when he did try it out, the picture quality was excellent. We are now trying to figure out a way for him to use it with his laptop for a monitor.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: A. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for under three months and have kept it in perfect condition. I use it as an XBOX 360 monitor and also as an external PC monitor. It worked two hours ago and has randomly stopped working. TV screen goes gray with any input and have tried disconnecting and using one cord at a time to see if any input into the monitor works. Sound still works but that is it. Cannot access the menu and the TV will shut off randomly. When I call them for customer support the representative from the company was the least bit helpful and rude. I was told I need to sent it back to get repaired and they gave me an adress. I asked him if they could ship me a box to send it in, becuase being in the Army I do not have enough space for my own personal belongings, nevermind holding onto a 4ftX4ft box. The representative told me to go out and buy my own box, when I informed him I am not allowed to leave post except for certain weekends and I am not allowed to have a car in or around post, he told me he couldn't help me. This is unacceptable considering the TV is brand new and already broken. Instead of taking the $40 taxi ride and buying probably paying $50 to package and ship this back for a free repair, I have bought a new TV with Vizio, which are the TV's most of my friends have. Vizio is known for outstanding quality and customer support and I hope to never have to have another run in with ViewSonic and their customer "support" team.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY
Reviews.Author: D. K. THOMAS "LOONYKAI"
Reviews.Content: I AM VERY HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE OF THE VIEWSONIC VT2430. I WAITED 3 MONTHS TO WRITE MY REVIEW BECAUSE THERE WERE SOME REVIEWS FAULTING THE PERFORMANCE OF THIS TV. I HAVE HAD NO PERFORMANCE PROBLEMS WHATSOEVER.I HAD PROBLEMS HOOKING UP MY DVD PLAYER AND DIRECTV BOX FOR THERE WAS NOT A GOOD DIAGRAM OF HOW TO DO SO. BY TRAIL AND ERROR I MANAGED TO GET IT RIGHT, BUT NO FAULT BUT MY OWN IN NOT KNOWING WHAT I WAS DOING.THE PICTURE IS DECENT,COULD BE A LITTLE CRISPER. SOUND SEEMS FINE. I SIT LEVEL WITH THE TV AND APPROX. 5 FEET AWAY, ITS THE PERFECT SIZE AT THAT DISTANCE. THE TV LOOKS SHARP, I LIKE THE PIANO BLACK FINISH.I FOUND THE REMOTE EASY TO USE AND THE ON SCREEN SETUP SELF EXPLANITORY.I HAVE NOT HOOKED UP MY LAPTOP TO THE TV YET, BUT LIKE THE ABILITY TO DO SO.THIS IS MY FIRST LCD TV AND AM QUITE HAPPY THAT I CAN MOVE IT MYSELF, MY OLD TV WAS A 32 INCH AND TO HEAVY AND BULKY FOR ME TO MOVE MYSELF.ALL IN ALL I'M VERY HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE.KAI FROM CA.

Reviews.Title: Headphone socket issues
Reviews.Author: P. Elliott "Our Man Flint"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice unit and I had no troubles setting it up where I wanted it.  It's nice and light so it sits on top of the DVD and Tivo players.I was disappointed by the actual size of the picture, since I had measured our previous tube TV diagonally and determined the LCD replacement based on that, but didn't take into account the fact that the LCD diagonal screen size measurement was based on its wide screen shape and therefore the height measurement would end up being smaller than our current TV screen.  So watch out for that if you're replacing something you already have for the bedroom for example.  I eventually sent this TV back and replaced it with a 32" for this reason and the headphone socket.Since this is in the bedroom, occasionally I was still watching a TV show after my wife had fallen asleep, so I used the headphone socket a few times to listen without disturbing her.  After maybe 5 times of using this socket (with a pair of Sony headphones), the removal of the headphone plug no longer returned sound to the speakers.  It seems that the headphone socket was apparently stuck in the open position even after taking the plug out.  I called Viewsonic support and they weren't able to help.  They gave me a case number and said they would call back with a returns number.  5 days later I gave up on them and just got a returns number from J&R; (the store it was actually shipped from) who would very helpful and since I was within 30 days had no problem taking it back.  As I write this, I am waiting for the credit to my account and I know it arrived at their offices yesterday, but this doesn't seem like it will be a problem.So in summary, I would suggest you take note of the actual screen height, not just the diagonal measurement when replacing your existing TV if you have one, and if you're never going to use the headphone socket, you should be fine with this model, which has perfectly fine looks, good picture and good sound for a small unit.  Of course, many people say 1080p at this size is not even noticable, and I would have to agree, and most HD shows are delivered in 720p so you're not going to see much of a gain over 720p models unless you intend to watch Blu-Ray I expect.

Reviews.Title: If this is to be your PC monitor - stay away from it!
Reviews.Author: Der Schoene Bahnhof
Reviews.Content: I read good reviews on this flat TV/monitor and it was attractively priced. The form factor looked decent as well. However, as soon as I played a movie, it looked really grainy and edges were jagged.When I connected a computer through HDMI the image looked terrible. When the same computer is connected to a Dell 2409 though (with the same HDMI cable), the image on the Dell looks sharp and crisp.It seems to me that they are doing some kind of processing on the video signal, perhaps chroma sub sampling, which results in characters appearing jagged, with a halo around them. Thin lines look thicker than they should be, and don't even talk to me about web pages containing small text. Depending on the type of chroma sub sampling they are doing, this reduces the effective resolution by a factor of 2 or more. I can't confirm this is chroma sub sampling, but it looks like it. I haven't gone through checking whether it only takes YUV as input or RGB.Selling this product as a "1920x1080 resolution" monitor and "brilliant" display is just a marketing lie. Even if the actual resolution of the LCD panel is 1080p, the image processing that they are applying to the input signal makes it look more like a 960x540. Furthermore the initial setting out of the box looks a bit soft and way too bluish.As a cheap TV it may be ok, but other competing products from Samsung that I have seen at the same price show a crisp picture when connected to a PC.My recommendation: there are better products out there. Don't buy this one. As for me I just returned it as it will not fit its intended use (mostly as PC monitor and sometimes as TV).

The sound is terriable and the picture isn't sharp at all so I decided to send it back. Called dell's customer service and somebody from India(I guess?from the accent) answered the phone. It took about 25 minutes and the guy alwasy put me on hold. Finally I received the label.When I tried to disassemble the TV I found they made it impossible for you to disconnect the stand, it is locked in permanently. So I had to unscrew it and it took me more than 20 minutes to put everything in the box. That thing is going to take a road trip soon.Will never recommend it to anybody. It is cheap stuff. Will buy a reputable brand like Panasonic and Sony. Viewsonic isn't worth the money. With $100 more you can get high quality ones.

Reviews.Title: poor sharpness, no definition
Reviews.Author: C. Ho
Reviews.Content: After reading the good reviews, I brought this unit couple weeks ago.  I am using it for TV only and have it plugged into my Comcast cable.  The color is good and natural, the quality of the speaker is so-so but surprisingly, it can be very loud.  I use it in the kitchen and have to set it at about 20%; otherwise, it will be too loud.For no apparent reason, the unit received no signal from the cable after one week.  I noticed that when I turn it on, the Viewsonic wallpaper, the three birds appears in grey. I tested it by hooking it up to the PC, same thing happened, no signal from the PC either.  But after some plugging and unplugging, miraculously, the color and the signal came back.  It's been another week, so far so good.  I hope it is not some loose wire inside the unit that caused the problem.Anyway, my major complaint is that the picture on this unit has absolutely no definition, I don't know if it is because I do not have HD channel or what, but the quality of the picture is so blend that my old Samsung box TV's picture is better.  It is especially bad on light color objects, you only see a patch of color and not much more.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT FEATURES,....BUT...
Reviews.Author: M. Chang
Reviews.Content: I am essentially pleased with this tv set, but had to go through many steps before I can say this:  I am moderately hearing impaired and depend upon CLOSED CAPTIONS to complete my understanding of any dialogue.  I was able to get the captions on the TV SETTING, but no matter what I did, reading and rereading the manual, could not get captions on the HDMI..high definition settings.  When I first emailed the VIEWSONIC website I was returned with a very polite email..and the directions were just a repeat of the manual.  After two or three more back and forths, I was advised that the HDMI does NOT support captions. I then wrote to J&R;, the seller of this tv set.  They were very cooperative and contacted VIEWSONIC on my behalf.  The rep was also advised that VIEWSONIC, indeed, does not suport the captioning on HDMI.  I felt that I was going to have to spend the rest of my VIEWSONIC viewing on the TV setting, in order to get the captions.  However, when my cable service people learned of my problem, they were able to get captions through my cable features.  I am now enjoying the full enjoyable features of the VIEWSONIC TV, no thanks to them.

Reviews.Title: Not good for use as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: Adrian LaVallee
Reviews.Content: I bought this HDTV for dual use as a monitor (95% of the time) and as a TV in our Travel Trailer (a few weekends a year).  So the first thing I did was hook it up to my PC, as that is what matters most.  The results were extremely disappointing.  Text was blocky, diagonal lines looked jagged, and essentially the entire screen looked like it had gone through an "emboss" filter.  This is with my desktop at a setting of 1920x1080, the panel's native resolution.  It should look pixel perfect, just like the 22" Vizio 1080p I was expecting to replace.  Instead, it looks like the image has been scaled up from their stated "optimum PC resolution" of 1360x768 - way too low resolution.  Why a HDTV/monitor with a true 1080p panel has an optimum resolution of anything OTHER than 1920x1080 is beyond me.  Regardless, I sent it back, and am out $45 return shipping (purchased from J&R; through Amazon, who I see is not currently selling this unit anymore, perhaps too many returns).  From now on, I won't be buying a TV/Monitor online without seeing it somewhere first!!  I'm giving two stars instead of one as a benefit of the doubt that as a TV it may look fine.  I didn't even try it as such.
